channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dreams Don’t Pay the Rent: What Panera’s Founder Taught Johnny’s Pork Roll
item.description: Panera founder Ron Shaich coaches Johnny Yarusi on risk, resilience, and building the “greatest breakfast sandwich in America.”

item.title: e.l.f. Beauty’s CDIO says she’s responsible for AI’s foundation, but that these tools aren’t an IT mandate
item.description: Ekta Chopra, the chief digital information officer of e.l.f. Beauty, acts as a champion of generative AI and helps make it pervasive across the compan...

item.title: For OpenAI’s chief revenue officer, research chops rather than ‘big marketing efforts’ is the key to winning customers
item.description: At Fortune Brainstorm Tech, OpenAI chief revenue officer Ashley Kramer says keeping rivals at bay will take more than flashy marketing

item.title: Here are the main features you’re sacrificing if you buy Apple’s new ultra-thin iPhone Air
item.description: It's the boldest iPhone design in years. But it doesn't come without some compromises.

item.title: Ben & Jerry’s ‘not for sale’ says Magnum CEO ahead of spin-off from Unilever
item.description: Magnum CEO Peter ter Kulve dismissed any talk of selling Ben & Jerry’s on Wednesday and said he was focused on reclaiming market share and growing sal...

item.title: Millennials refuse to give up ‘lol’
item.description: Are you overly reliant on an emotional-support “lol” at the end of a text? Do you stop yourself from adding “lol” to work emails and Slack messages? A...

item.title: Las Vegas mayor says the city is suffering from a serious drop in Canadian tourists: ‘We need you, and we miss you’
item.description: Shelley Berkley echoed worries from last month when she said traffic from Canada and Mexico has "gone from a faucet to a drip."

item.title: Taco Bell Went All In on AI Ordering. Here’s Why It Backed Off
item.description: Automating its drive-through windows and counters seemed like a slam dunk. Here are 5 things AI didn’t provide.

item.title: AI Isn’t Coming for Your Job—It’s Coming for Your Whole Org Chart
item.description: Here’s how to make yourself irreplaceable.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says economy is ‘weakening’ but he can’t make sense of all the different data: ‘Maybe, one day, AI will fix that problem’
item.description: The economy produced nearly a million less jobs than first thought. "Whether that is on the way to recession or just weakening, I don’t know," Dimon t...

item.title: A federal court sides with Lisa Cook, ruling she can remain the Fed’s governor for now
item.description: A federal court has ruled that embattled Federal Reserve Gov. Lisa Cook can remain in her position while she fights President Donald Trump’s efforts t...

item.title: New speakers added to Fast Company’s Innovation Festival
item.description: Fast Company’s 11th annual Innovation Festival lands in New York City next week, but there’s still plenty of time to buy your pass and build your sche...

item.title: How Uber Will Expand Into Helicopter Trips in 2026
item.description: Following Joby Aviation’s acquisition of Blade earlier this summer, Uber will offer helicopters as an option, starting with airport routes.

item.title: 3 Ways to Make Your AI Company Stand Out From the Crowd
item.description: The big players are dominating AI. To compete in a saturated marketplace, AI companies need to stand out. Here’s how they can do that.

item.title: A South Korean charter plane is headed to the U.S. to bring back Hyundai workers detained by ICE
item.description: A South Korean charter plane left for the U.S. on Wednesday to bring back Korean workers detained in an immigration raid in Georgia last week. A total...

item.title: Economic calendar: PPI, first of week’s two key inflation readings, minutes away
PPI report shows U.S. wholesale inflation moderating in August — live updates
Oracle rally and tame PPI data keep all-time highs in play for S&P and Nasdaq
